Comment 4: 
I think it is the same. Originally I thought it was because of (see example in 3915)

var c3 mybool = c2 == (x < y) // illegal because x < y is of type bool now

which I believe should be legal. The wording in the spec could be clearer - I think we
should simply say that the result of a comparison is an untyped boolean (however, that
would be the only case where an untyped value is not constant - at least as far as it's
visible to a programmer).

- gri
